i just had a really good conversation with paulina...shes such a great person. i found someone that i could talk to about my problems and thats what i did, and so now i just feel so much better. we share a lot in common. she listens to me and gives me advice, thats exactly what i needed. thank god, now i dont have to fall asleep crying...again. my spirits have lifted so much now...i went from severely depressed to relieved and happy. words of wisdom: find someone that you can talk to about your feelings...someone that you can trust, someone who will understand. it will make you feel great to get it all out of the way.

here i am again, alone in this hell house my loneliness surrounds me, getting worse and worse every day until the time i see the one, who makes me feel bright, happy, loved and its during those moments I wish that time would stop so that I could live forever. feeling so good, so happy but until that time arrives, i must wait. try to survive try not to let the sadnesses of my life get to me i simply love you, i know these feelings are true what would I do without you? without your voice? without your sweet face? theres some sort of connection, there must be something there i feel what you feel your sadness is my sadness. your happy, I'm happy and thats how i know, how i can tell, theres no other explanation it must be love

school on friday wasnt too bad at all. the ECC field trip was a lot better than expected. we were there to learn about jobs realated to our personal interests. We were put into groups according to these interests and i was in the artistic group along with a lot of my other friends, mel, nicole, sean, and stevens caitlin was in my group too. it was so interesting how i get along great with all the people who were put into my group, hmmm maybe because we all share similar interests. but anyway, we got to go see alot of really fascinating things at ECC. our group went into a dark room were a class was developing pictures and we saw a lot of awesome art....paintings and a lot of other stuff. then we all got to go to burger king for lunch where me and mel sat with this cross-eyed teacher with a long pony tail. it was strange because i was talking to him and none of his eyes were looking at me. but hes a cool teacher..... i had alot of fun on the bus ride was fun too. i had a lot of time to get to know mel, i spent most of my day there with her. shes cool and shes friends with pauilina too. finally, i have two friends that actually get along with eachother so i can have more than 1 friend over at a time. oh shit, lani should be calling me soon, maybe i should get offline.

Breathe in for luck, breathe in so deep, this air is blessed, you share with me. This night is wild, so calm and dull, these hearts they race, from self control. Your legs are smooth, as they graze mine, we're doing fine, we're doing nothing at all. My hopes are so high, that your kiss might kill me. So won't you kill me, so I die happy. My heart is yours to fill or burst, to break or bury, or wear as jewelery, which ever you prefer. The words are hushed lets not get busted; just lay entwined here, undiscovered. Safe in here, from all the stupid questions. "hey did you get some?" Man, that is so dumb. Stay quiet, stay near, stay close they can't hear... so we can get some. My hopes are so high that your kiss might kill me. So won't you kill me, so I die happy. My heart is yours to fill or burst, to break or bury, or wear as jewelery, which ever you prefer. Hands down this is the best day I can ever remember, I'll always remember the sound of the stereo, the dim of the soft lights, the scent of your hair that you twirled in your fingers and the time on the clock when we realized it's so late and this walk that we shared together. The streets were wet and the gate was locked so I jumped it, and let you in. And you stood at the door with your hands on my waist and you kissed me like you meant it. And I knew that you meant it, that you meant it, that you meant it, and I knew, that you meant it, that you meant it.

sometimes i just hate my life so much. so much that i could care less about being alive or not. there are so many things going on that i want to talk about with someone but i cant, another reason that i'm depressed. THers just no one that i can talk to about my problems, with my family, my friends, myself. its just everything about my life, the way i am treated by everyone, the way i act around people. sometimes, i just simply dont like my life...or it may be that i dont like myself. all of my thoughts and emotions stay bottled up inside of me, i cant talk about them with anyone. Theres no one who would understand me. who would? my mind is so messed up, theres no one who understands whats going on inside of me, i dont even understand myself.

you're always in your dark solitude, pushing others away when what you really want is for them to be closer. the ones you love will never know your true colors. never know your true feelings for them.
forgive and forget...but don't expect others to do the same for you.

ok theres this game called "telephone"and all of us played it as children. or at least most of us. well in this game a group of people sit in a circle. one person makes up a sentence and whispers it to the person next to them. then the second person whispers what he heard to the next person in line until the sentence has been whispered throughout the entire circle. and when it gets back to the original person the sentence is spoken aloud and comes out completely different than what it had started out as. this is just a little thing to think about before u make assumptions.

One day as a small opening appeared on a cocoon, a man sat for several hours watching the butterfly struggle to force its body through that little hole. Then it seemed to stop making any progress. It appeared as if it had gotten as far as it could and it could go no further. So the man decided to help the butterfly. He took a pair of scissors and snipped off the remaining bit of the cocoon. The butterfly then emerged easily, but it had a swollen body and small, shriveled wings. The wings would enlarge and expand to be able to support the body, which would contract in time. Neither happened. In fact, the butterfly spent the rest of its life crawling around with a swollen body and shriveled wings. It never was able to fly. What the man, in his kindness and haste, did not understand was that the restricting cocoon and the struggle required for the butterfly to get through the tiny opening was nature's way of forcing fluid from the body of the butterfly into its wings. Then the butterfly would be ready for flight once it achieved its freedom from the cocoon. Sometimes struggles are exactly what we need in our life. If we were allowed to go through our life without any obstacles, it would cripple us. We would not be as strong as what we could be. We could never fly.
